solution.text:
\(\frac{_{k}_y+_{{2*j}}_}{_{j}_-_{{3*k}}_y} =\frac23\)
Cross multiply, i.e. take the denominator of one side to the numerator of the other side and multiply that numerator.
\(\Rightarrow 3(_{k}_y+_{{2*j}}_) = 2(_{j}_-_{{3*k}}_y)\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{9*k}}_y= _{{2*j}}_-_{{6*j}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{9*k}}_y=-_{{4*j}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow y=\frac {-_{{4*j}}_}{_{{9*k}}_}\)
